front.title: Semi-Static Diffie-Hellman Key Establishment for TLS 1.3

abstract.t: TLS 1.3 [RFC8446] specifies a signed Diffie-Hellman exchange modelled after SIGMA [SIGMA]. This design is suitable for endpoints whose certified credential is a signing key, which is the common situation for current TLS servers. This document describes a mode of TLS 1.3 in which one or both endpoints have a certified DH key which is used to authenticate the exchange. Note to Readers Source for this draft and an issue tracker can be found at https://github.com/ekr/draft-rescorla-tls13-semistatic-dh (https://github.com/ekr/draft-rescorla-tls13-semistatic-dh).
